description:
These commits:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I7826087147e0713edaaea85a72283998295e2281,n,z

mean we're using an oslo.config tarball from http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo.config/

Once oslo.config-1.2.0 has been published to pypi, we should switch to:

  oslo.config>=1.2.0
title: Switch to oslo.config 1.2.0 final

comments.content:
Cinder doesn't require any of the new APIs in 1.2.0, so it's actually perfectly fine for it to stick with:

  oslo.config>=1.1.0

That's why I didn't post a Cinder patch
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content:
so does ironic

> Cinder doesn't require any of the new APIs in 1.2.0, so it's actually
> perfectly fine for it to stick with:
>

>
> That's why I didn't post a Cinder patch
